framework: DSV (Deconstruct, Synthesize, and Verify) - Ablation Version
input_sentence: It is always the case that if the other vehicle is to the left of the ego vehicle and the ego vehicle drives faster than the other vehicle, then the ego vehicle is to the right of a broad lane marking and the other vehicle is to the left of a solid lane marking.

atomic_propositions.description: Other vehicle is to the left of ego vehicle
Ego vehicle drives faster than other vehicle
Ego vehicle is to the right of broad lane marking
Other vehicle is to the left of solid lane marking

temporal_relations.description: If other vehicle is left of ego AND ego drives faster than other, then ego is right of broad lane marking AND other is left of solid lane marking

lexicon.other_left_of_ego: Other vehicle is to the left of ego vehicle
lexicon.ego_faster_than_other: Ego vehicle drives faster than other vehicle
lexicon.ego_right_of_broad: Ego vehicle is to the right of broad lane marking
lexicon.other_left_of_solid: Other vehicle is to the left of solid lane marking

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Extract object names from objects list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other
   - obj_broad_lane_marking → broad_lane_marking
   - obj_solid_lane_marking → solid_lane_marking

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: to_left_of(other,ego) [other vehicle is to left of ego vehicle]
   - ap_2: drives_faster_than(ego,other) [ego drives faster than other vehicle]
   - ap_3: to_right_of(ego,broad_lane_marking) [ego is to right of broad lane marking]
   - ap_4: to_left_of(other,solid_lane_marking) [other is to left of solid lane marking]

3. Build the implication relation:
   - Antecedent: to_left_of(other,ego) & drives_faster_than(ego,other)
   - Consequent: to_right_of(ego,broad_lane_marking) & to_left_of(other,solid_lane_marking)
   - Implication: (to_left_of(other,ego) & drives_faster_than(ego,other)) -> (to_right_of(ego,broad_lane_marking) & to_left_of(other,solid_lane_marking))

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

Final MTL Formula:
G((to_left_of(other,ego) & drives_faster_than(ego,other)) -> (to_right_of(ego,broad_lane_marking) & to_left_of(other,solid_lane_marking)))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Extract object names from objects list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other
   - obj_broad_lane_marking → broad_lane_marking
   - obj_solid_lane_marking → solid_lane_marking

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: to_left_of(other,ego) [other vehicle is to left of ego vehicle]
   - ap_2: drives_faster_than(ego,other) [ego drives faster than other vehicle]
   - ap_3: to_right_of(ego,broad_lane_marking) [ego is to right of broad lane marking]
   - ap_4: to_left_of(other,solid_lane_marking) [other is to left of solid lane marking]

3. Build the implication relation:
   - Antecedent: to_left_of(other,ego) & drives_faster_than(ego,other)
   - Consequent: to_right_of(ego,broad_lane_marking) & to_left_of(other,solid_lane_marking)
   - Implication: (to_left_of(other,ego) & drives_faster_than(ego,other)) -> (to_right_of(ego,broad_lane_marking) & to_left_of(other,solid_lane_marking))

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula begins with the global operator `G`, meaning "Always" or "Globally" that the following implication must hold.
- The antecedent (left side of implication) contains two predicates connected by `&` (and):
  - `to_left_of(other,ego)` is a relational predicate meaning "the other vehicle is to the left of the ego vehicle"
  - `drives_faster_than(ego,other)` means "the ego vehicle drives faster than the other vehicle"
- The consequent (right side of implication) also contains two predicates connected by `&`:
  - `to_right_of(ego,broad_lane_marking)` means "the ego vehicle is to the right of the broad lane marking"
  - `to_left_of(other,solid_lane_marking)` means "the other vehicle is to the left of the solid lane marking"
- The implication `->` translates to "implies" or "requires that"
- Since this is a global condition with no specific time bounds, it applies continuously over all time

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if the other vehicle is to the left of the ego vehicle and the ego vehicle drives faster than the other vehicle, then the ego vehicle must be to the right of the broad lane marking and the other vehicle must be to the left of the solid lane marking.

verification_result.back_translation: Always, if the other vehicle is to the left of the ego vehicle and the ego vehicle drives faster than the other vehicle, then the ego vehicle must be to the right of the broad lane marking and the other vehicle must be to the left of the solid lane marking.

  - `drives_faster_than(ego,other)` means "the ego vehicle drives faster than the other vehicle"

  - `to_left_of(other,solid_lane_marking)` means "the other vehicle is to the left of the solid lane marking"
- The implication `->` translates to "implies" or "requires that"

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components

verifier.name: Verifier_Agent
verifier.description: Responsible for verifying the semantic correctness of MTL formulas through back-translation
